result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin Nmi Cooper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Martin Nmi Cooper is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Martin Nmi Cooper was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Martin Nmi Cooper was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
Defendant must continue with psychological evaluation and follow thru with crrent treatment plan.

The defendant may not possess/consume any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter into any bars/taverns or other class B establishments.
The defendant must take all medications as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed by a treating physician.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin Nmi Cooper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Martin Nmi Cooper in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:37 PM. Also called 16CV16. State - have filed the civil file on the vehicle involved in the 16CF01 case, it has been seized pursuant to statute and understands that the defendant will not be objecting to it and forfeiting the vehicle to the FOSO. Cooper agrees. Court informs that the case was just filed today and normal procedure would be to allow him time to file an answer, explains seizure of the vehicle. Cooper agrees and is not objecting to the seizure of the vehicle. State - this is not involved in the consention for the criminal case. Laska agrees as does Cooper, they know that the seizure is not part of any deal in the criminal matter. Court signs the order and Clerk provides defendant with copy of the signed Order. State - 16CF01 - resolved - amend count #2 to misd possession of THC contrary to 961.41(3g)(e), dismiss counts #3 and #4, plead to #1 as alleged and #2 as amended, withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: court costs on count #1, #2 - fine of $500.00 plus costs and surcharges, AODA and follow thru, anger management and psycholigical counseling or follow thru with current treatment, absolute sobreity, no possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars, taverns or Class B establishments, full time employment/school, 150 hours of community service, take all medications as prescribed by treating physician or medical provider. Laska and Cooper agree. Court dismisses counts #3 and #4. Court amends count #2 to misd possession of THC contrary to 961.41(3g)(e) - reads new charge and penalties. Cooper pleads G to count #1 as alleged and G to count #2 as amended. Court has plea qustionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final arguement prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Laska makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Cooper makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 -  withhold sentence and place on probation with conditions of:  count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, costs - take bond posted, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 150 hours of community service, take all medications as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed by a treating physician, continue with psychological evaluation and follow thru with current treatment plan; count #2 - $500.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - take bond posted - refund remainder to poster, submit DNA sample - instructs on expungement, credit for 28 days only if revoked, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 4, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Martin Nmi Cooper in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:39 AM. Laska indicates case has not been resolved. Court will set for JT.  Jury trial scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 08:30 am. Bond continued.

Defendant Martin Nmi Cooper, in custody, in court with attorney Cana G Laska. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:26 PM. State calls first witness, Tom Robinson, sworn in (1:26 PM). State directs. Identification of defendant, 1:33 PM. State offers Michigan JOC, marked as exhibit #1. Cross examine by Laska, 1:35 PM. State - objection, relavance - sustained. Witness excused, 1:38 PM. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State files INFO which mirrors. Proceed with ARGN, Laska waives further reading and enters NG plea to all counts. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Martin Nmi Cooper in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:08 AM. Defendant has complaint and waives further reading and requests a PH. Court - informs state Order to Appear will need to be done. Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Martin Nmi Cooper not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:08 AM. State - believes the defendant is unavailable for Court today for stated reasons and asks Court to set an adjourned date. Court sets for another INIT, State to prepare an Order to Appear.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.
